summary: The bill, titled the Middle Class Mortgage Insurance Premium Act of 2025, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It proposes increasing the income cap for the mortgage insurance premium deduction to $200,000 for joint filers and $100,000 for single filers, and making the deduction permanent. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on April 9, 2025, and referred to the Committee on Ways and Means. The effective date for the amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
